sn3.23:1: At Sāvatthī. Sitting to one side, King Pasenadi of Kosala said to the Blessed One: "Venerable sir, how many things are there in the world which, when they arise, arise for one's harm, suffering, and discomfort?"[n.252] Cp. withSN3.2. The verses are identical.
sn3.23:2: v.433"Greed, hatred, and delusion,Arisen from within oneself,Injure the person of evil mindAs its own fruit destroys the reed."
